docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20--Secretary of State Dean Rusk departed tonight for the interAmerican foreign ministers' meeting in Uruguay with an expression of confidence that "the most effective possible means" would be found to deal with the Castro regime in...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20--Secretary of State Dean Rusk departed tonight for the interAmerican foreign ministers' meeting in Uruguay with an expression of confidence that "the most effective possible means" would be found to deal with the Castro regime in Cuba.

headline.main: RUSK IS HOPEFUL OF CURB ON CUBA; Confident as He Leaves for Inter-American Parley

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: It is tempting, but premature, to describe the hemispheric meeting that starts in Punta del Este, Uruguay, tomorrow as of great historic importance. History will judge its importance by the results. A resounding success or failure would be of...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is tempting, but premature, to describe the hemispheric meeting that starts in Punta del Este, Uruguay, tomorrow as of great historic importance. History will judge its importance by the results. A resounding success or failure would be of transcendent importance, but the conference might well end in a stalemate.
docs.abstract: Conf outlook for Rusk and US position discussed; speculation on effects of Latin-Amer resistance to punitive stand; cartoons

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Jan. 20--Diplomatic consultations began in earnest here today for an inter-American formula to counteract the dangers of Communist control of Cuba.

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Jan. 21--Cuba's delegation, led by President Osvaldo Dorticos Torrado, was in selfimposed isolation at a beachside hotel today while diplomats from other American republics consulted on how best to deal with the Cuban...
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Jan. 21--Cuba's delegation, led by President Osvaldo Dorticos Torrado, was in selfimposed isolation at a beachside hotel today while diplomats from other American republics consulted on how best to deal with the Cuban problem.
docs.abstract: speculation on Cuban plans to benefit from others' disunity

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Jan. 21--Secretary of State Dean Rusk said today that the success of the Alliance for Progress program depended on the security of the Western Hemisphere against outside interference.
